venue.address_2: cross street Center between Chapel and Crown
venue.name: Bentara

item.description:
PechaKucha Night comes to New Haven

"New Haven has started its own edition of PechaKucha Night, an event that celebrates creativity and innovation. It was founded by designers in Tokyo as a way to share ideas succinctly and creatively. The event has grown to include anyone and everyone in cities around the world; individuals or groups present creative ideas or innovations using 20 images shown for 20 seconds each. The ideas can solve social problems or just be a cool innovation, or new project. Neighbors, colleagues, journalists, designers, architects, social entrepreneurs, and artists have all presented at PechaKucha nights."

Tonight's Format: 10 presenters, showing 20 slides for 20 seconds each. Informal Q&A with networking follows. Arrive early for a table & dinner service if that's your preference.

Admission is free for campaign workers and Voters. Yep. Everyone.

"From brainy Terry Dagradi on the Cushing Center exhibit and Bruce Seymour on the mad future of mobile to Kyle Skar’s Architectural answer to heated Arctic Politics and Judy Rosenthal's Bali... you don’t want to miss this."

The host for tonight will be Eric T, contact info in RSVP

For more details, see schedule below or go to http://pkn-newhaven.o...

A preview of the 20x20s:

Terry Dagradi Redefines [Cushing] Brainy,

Diana Ofosu tells us about Site Projects’ Film Shorts Competition,

Kyle Skar Maps Out an Arctic Ark,

Judy Rosenthal on Reverence in Bali,

Bruce Seymour looks at the Future of Mobile Communication,

Matthew Browning on Collaborative Connectivity,

Greg Garvey explores the Dissociation side of the tech world,

Jerome Harris brings us Megahurtz, and

Ian Applegate on the ABCs of Solar.


Come on out for what promises to be an interesting evening!
item.name: **TONIGHT PechaKucha New Haven
